chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob A Silverman

defendant.name: Silverman, Jacob A
defendant.address: 1327 W Main St # 1, Lake Geneva, WI 53147

records.addlTxt: EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Defendant Jacob A Silverman in court.  Attorney Obi Uzowulu in court for Jacob A Silverman.  Attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for State of Wisconsin. Called @ 2:09 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for status conference. Record by Atty. Uzowulu that defendant has been accepted into Mt. Zion House for treatment and asks that status be set for when treatment is completed. Court instructs Atty. Uzowulu to file documents from Mt. Zion as to date of acceptance, length of program, and matter will be set once that is filed. No objection by the State or Atty. Uzowulu. Clerk to notify Judge Koss's clerk that matter to be set for status after completion of treatment at Mt. Zion house. Court in recess.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Defendant in court with attorney Uzowulu. ADA Crawford appears for the State of Wisconsin. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Parties proceed to arraignment. Not guilty pleas entered. Matter set over 04/28/22 at 115 pm

(64-06)   DA Wiedenfeld in court for the State. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared in court for Jacob A Silverman. Defendant Jacob A Silverman not in court.
Attorney Uzowulu made a record, defendant's car broke down and is requesting a new court date.
No objection from the State.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob A Silverman in court with attorney Mackenzie Renner for attorney Obi Uzowulu.  James T. Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Initial appearance, defendant given complaint, read by court, charges/penalites explained.  Preliminary hearing rights given & hearing requested iwth time period waived.  Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 21, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
Defendant Jacob A Silverman in court with attorney Obi Uzowulu.  Andrew Herrmann for State of Wisconsin.  Body cam video requested.  Mintues filed.
Defendant Jacob A Silverman in court in custody via video with attorney Leah Selmek.  Defendant does qualify for SPD.  Bond remains.  Defendant on PO Hold.  Minutes filed.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores.  Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH DEPUTY N. BIRCH EXCEPT IN HIS PROFESSIONAL CAPACITY.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-16 & 22-17
Original Bond filed with Court.  Defendant refused to sign bond.
